nexttext: where $Q_i$ is the displacement of the phonon mode with $\gamma_i$ and $\omega_{0i}$ is the damping ratio and angular frequency respectively. $F(t)$ is the force which drives the displacements, which we assign to the population in{~\em I} only, i.e. $F(t) \propto n_1(t)$. In principle, the population of all the states could contribute to the force; however we found that the quality of the fit did not significantly improve when other force terms were included. The phonon modes then couple to the dielectric function as

where $Q_i$ is the displacement of the phonon mode with $\gamma_i$ and $\omega_{0i}$ is the damping ratio and angular frequency respectively. $F(t)$ is the force which drives the displacements, which we assign to the population in{~\em I} only, i.e. $F(t) \propto n_1(t)$. In principle, the population of all the states could contribute to the force; however we found that the quality of the fit did not significantly improve when other force terms were included.
